content.raw:
Some notes:

* It would be good to build against the default branch of math, common, msgs and transport for now, so we're up-to-date with them
* For reference, pipelines is [running](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/039f8877d173f9d759e74487328557e727a7acdb/bitbucket-pipelines.yml?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) for ign-gui on Xenial, but I can't run tests due to the lack of X-server
* Ign-gui has support for coverage, it would be cool to have a coverage job
* Ign-gui won't build on windows at the moment, we need common to build first.
* Not sure what's the current status on homebrew, but I remember @iche033 was able to build it a while back
content.html:
Some notes:

  • It would be good to build against the default branch of math, common, msgs and transport for now, so we're up-to-date with them
  • For reference, pipelines is running for ign-gui on Xenial, but I can't run tests due to the lack of X-server
  • Ign-gui has support for coverage, it would be cool to have a coverage job
  • Ign-gui won't build on windows at the moment, we need common to build first.
  • Not sure what's the current status on homebrew, but I remember @iche033 was able to build it a while back

content.raw: just pull the latest [commit](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/1b2e3f37bee322da29396387e8269df3d447bf97) from ign-gui and compiles fine.
content.html: just pull the latest commit from ign-gui and compiles fine.

content.raw: Thanks for checking!
content.html: Thanks for checking!

content.raw: some fixes relatred to the lack of GPU in `ign_gui_fixes`. The Qt5 support for Windows will require of including a configure.bat file (like the one in Gazebo) inside the ign_gui repository. If we need to skip trusty, we need to add conditionals in DSL code not to generate them in the case of distro == trusty an ign_sw == ign_gui.
content.html: some fixes relatred to the lack of GPU in ign_gui_fixes. The Qt5 support for Windows will require of including a configure.bat file (like the one in Gazebo) inside the ign_gui repository. If we need to skip trusty, we need to add conditionals in DSL code not to generate them in the case of distro == trusty an ign_sw == ign_gui.

content.raw: Thanks for the GPU fixes and the blue build!
content.html: Thanks for the GPU fixes and the blue build!

content.raw: The latest homebrew error is `ld: library not found for -lintl`. Any clues, OSX people?
content.html: The latest homebrew error is ld: library not found for -lintl. Any clues, OSX people?

content.raw:
it's related to a dependency of gts:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/1691/intl-linking-error-in-os-x-yosemite-when
content.html:
it's related to a dependency of gts:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/1691/intl-linking-error-in-os-x-yosemite-when

content.raw:
I think we need some special logic to add the following code if gts is in use

~~~
export LIBRARY_PATH=${LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib
~~~
content.html:
I think we need some special logic to add the following code if gts is in use

export LIBRARY_PATH=${LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib

content.raw:
Thanks for the fix, @scpeters ! The homebrew jobs now build and there is only one test failure, which is Ign-GUI's fault.

Now Linux and OSX work. Windows will still take a while because of common, I suggest we merge this the way it is so there's at least some CI testing for ign-gui.
content.html:
Thanks for the fix, @scpeters ! The homebrew jobs now build and there is only one test failure, which is Ign-GUI's fault.

Now Linux and OSX work. Windows will still take a while because of common, I suggest we merge this the way it is so there's at least some CI testing for ign-gui.

content.raw: this form of \`gpu-reliable-${distro}\` comes from old times when we need to use the same node base system. We can just use `gpu-reliable` , both nvidia nodes are using this label too.
content.html: this form of `gpu-reliable-${distro}` comes from old times when we need to use the same node base system. We can just use gpu-reliable , both nvidia nodes are using this label too.
